page.title: 05The Ryedale Folk Museum
page.content: The museum was opened in 1964 by Mr Bertram Frank, with his own private collection combined with that of Mr Crosland,displayed in his barn.This was increased by local gifts. In a field behind the barn , a working blacksmith's shop was built, followed by reconstruction of an old cruck cottage, a manor house, a later cruck cottage,an Elizabethan glass furnace,a crofter's cottage, a barn and wheel- house and some shops, all built by Mr Frank with voluntary labour.In 1979 Mr Frank retired and now the museum is run by a curator and 3 paid assistants managed by a secretary and Board of Trustees. Doorkeepers are volunteers. Local crafts are demonstrated and this year these have been increased.In 1984 the museum entrance became a Tourist Information Centre. About 52000 people look round the museum each year.
